intro: Schizocolea ochreata, commonly known as the golden spurge, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant features succulent, fleshy leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers clustered in cyathia. Its yellowish-green coloration gives it its common name, and it is often found in dry, rocky habitats. Schizocolea ochreata is valued for its ornamental appeal and has some traditional medicinal uses.
